I don't know if it was due to pandemics but there are 4 points that I want to point out for the management to take notice into: 1. The food selection varies but lacking in taste. The beverages in the restaurant were almost always too sweet and it wasnt just me, my colleagues said the same. Most of the food tasted plain, so so. Once i had my lunch and ate mushrooms, it tasted like soap. 2. Lack of staff in restaurant. Some food stalls don't have a cook/waiter, so one cook/waiter have to handle several stalls serving several people. Often times i have to wait 2-5mins to get served. Another case, the cook have to get more ingredients/refill the food by themselves so the line have to wait longer. 3. The taste of coffees and other beverages in bar are so so, i can get way better coffee for 35k-45k in a coffee shop. But it's understandable for that price in a hotel. However, the breakfast is ridiculously overpriced. I said overpriced because if it were worth the price I wouldn't mind paying 130k for a breakfast. I got myself a menu called healthy egg, it served a white egg (scrambled/omelette), two sticks of asparagus, 3 spoons of mushroom, and supposedly feta cheese (but they ran out of feta so they use cheddar/mozarella as a substitute). I don't mind the small portion as it is common in a fine dining/hotel but the taste doesn't worth the price. 4. Interesting choice of snack. A whole chicken as a coffee break snack for one person, really? The coffee from a coffee machine in the meeting room tasted the same as 1 star hotel. For the price tag, I think Alana can do better.
